name: UpdateGiftCardConfiguration
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `GiftCardConfigurations:Edit`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "AllowCurrencyConversion": true,
  "AllowMultipleCardsPayment": true,
  "AllowRefundWithoutTransaction": true,
  "CardType": "string",
  "Data": {},
  "Handler": "Discount",
  "ID": 123,
  "Name": "string",
  "UsageType": 2
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/UpdateGiftCardConfiguration

B.name: AllowCurrencyConversion
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: AllowMultipleCardsPayment
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: AllowRefundWithoutTransaction
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: CardType
B.description:
Some gift card handlers are able to handle multiple types of cards. With this property you can set the card the handler should work with.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: Data
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: Handler
B.description:
While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

Possible values:

* `Discount`
* `AdyenStoredValue`
* `APIGIFTCARD`
* `EPAY`
* `FASHIONCHEQUE`
* `INTERSOLVE`

B.name: ID
B.description: This is the ID of a `GiftCardConfiguration`

B.name: Name
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: UsageType
B.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Sale
* `2` - Payment

While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

I.name: Code
I.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

I.name: Message
I.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

I.name: RequestID
I.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

I.name: Type
I.description: A short description of the error type.

J.name: ExternalIDs
J.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

J.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
J.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

J.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
J.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
